results.title: Blindness
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Walford Hewitson and Morten Parker
results.brief_description: The story of a man who lost his sight during the best years of his life. Filmed with the help of the Canadian National Institute for the Blind, this study of blindness tries to show the emotional effect of the sudden loss of sight and how a man so stricken climbs back from the brink of despair. How he learns a trade which enables him to support himself and eventually a family, is a story of quiet triumph convincingly portrayed. Starring Len Cariou

results.title: Blind man's bluff
results.creator_credit: Children's Film Foundation, Willis World Wide Films, Cyril Randell and Gerry O'Hara
results.brief_description: A young boy named Joe Hunter is kidnapped after his father wins 200,000 pounds in the lottery. His two young friends team up with Smithie, a blind man, and together they discover who kidnapped Joe, resulting in his rescue.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Children’s Film Foundation, Willis World Wide Films, Cyril Randell and Gerry O’Hara

results.title: Blind grace
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: New York City — a huge, slow pulse of light steaming through daytime and night time. A study of the soul of the city, its radiance, its isolates and its irates — the special souls who are lost to the vision of the workaday world but scorched into the vision of Cohen’s video world. A world of blindness, grace and vision. A world made more sacred by noise — the special noise composed in response to the city’s scorching radiance, another kind of soul music.

results.title: Bligh of the Bounty: world navigator
results.creator_credit: Rolf Harris Video Productions, Bruce Harris and Dennis Murphy
results.brief_description: A four-part television documentary presented by Rolf Harris, with accompanying book, about the life and journeys of Captain William Bligh. Captain of the ill-fated Bounty, Bligh was also a navigator, surveyor and explorer. The series covers the story of Captain Bligh from his birth to his death, and follows his voyages from England through the Canary Islands, the Caribbean and Canada to the South Pacific. The 112 page book ‘Mutiny on the Bounty’ presents an in-depth historical survey of the Mutiny, its causes and its consequences through essays, articles and colour illustrations.

results.title: BLEVE = Boiling liquid expansion vapourised explosion
results.creator_credit: Urban Image, National Fire Protection Association (U.S.) and Lawrence Rosenblum
results.brief_description: A fire safety and fire-fighting film about BLEVE - “Boiling Liquid Expansion Vapourised Explosion.” Includes several American newsclips dealing with large liquid petroleum gas cylinder fires.

results.title: Bleeding: what to do
results.creator_credit: David Adams, Pyramid Films and Yehuda Tarmu
results.brief_description: In the critical minutes before professional help arrives, what is done can mean the difference between life and death. The film shows how to stop the bleeding at once. Animation models and re-enactments are used to illustrate the physiology, main pressure points and effective first aid techniques. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Bleak Moments
results.creator_credit: Autumn, Memorial, BFI, Leslie Blair and Mike Leigh
results.brief_description: This first film by one of Britain’s most acclaimed theatrical creators already contains the seeds of such later successes as “Abigail’s Party” and “High Hopes”. A tippling spinster, a tongue-tied schoolteacher and a would-be pop star from Scunthorpe are just some of Mike Leigh’s brilliantly conceived gallery of suburban types, living lives of quiet desperation and frequent absurdity. Beneath the acid wit, there is also sympathy and a disturbing vision of Britain’s repressive society.

results.title: Blazing saddles (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Michael Hertzberg and Mel Brooks
results.brief_description: Cleavon Little is a black railroad worker in the 19th century mid-west who with the assistance of an alcoholic gunfighter tries to foil the plans of a crooked attorney and his henchmen. Well, that’s the supposed plot. In reality, “Blazing Saddles” is a continuously hilarious parody of Hollywood westerns (and Hollywood racism) featuring great comic performances by Gene Wilder, Madeline Kahn, Mel Brooks and Slim Pickens. In films such as “Blazing Saddles”, Mel Brooks consolidated his position as one of the most unique and talented of comics in contemporary American cinema. The film is co-scripted by Richard Pryor.

results.title: Blazing saddles
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Michael Hertzberg and Mel Brooks
results.brief_description: The land at Rock Ridge is worth a fortune, but strictly off limits to outside investors as the townsfolk already own their land. The only option is to drive them out by sending in the roughest, leanest, toughest gang you can muster and appoint a sheriff (Little) who is ill equipped to deal with their arrival. The black sheriff realises that the situation is out of his control and calls on a professional, one of the jail’s cons, who was also one of the fastest guns in the West. This is the overarching plot that serves as a vehicle for Mel Brook’s lunatic brand of humour aimed at a cineliterate audience. Includes Madeline Kahn’s Academy Award nomination performance in her Marlene Dietrich sendup. Cast includes Cleavon Little, Gene Wilder, Slim Pickens and David Huddleston. Screenplay by Mel Brooks, Norman Steinberg, Andrew Bergman, Richard Pryor and Alan Uger.
